page.title: 03HISTORICAL BUILDINGS
page.content: { LITTLE MORETON HALL} This is a fine example of a fifteenth century black and white moated house.The Hall has been in the ownership of the National Trust since 1936,when the last of the Moreton owners died.The house attracts visitors from a wide area.41,000 on average in a year.At Moreton the Trust looks after the general repairs and has recently renovated the roof by traditional craftsman methods. {RODE HALL} This is the seat of Sir Richard Baker Wilbraham.The original hall was built in 1700 but was converted into the service wing whenthe main block was added in 1732.The Hall contains many fine paintings and items of furniture. With it being a family home it has only open to the public two days a week.Nesfield planned the grounds.
